feels.name: Fear
feels.quote: I could not sustain the horror of my situation, and when I perceived that the popular voice and the countenances of the judges had already condemned my unhappy victim, I rushed out of the court in agony.

feels.name: Remorse
feels.quote: Despair! Who dared talk of that? The poor victim, who on the morrow was to pass the awful boundary between life and death, felt not, as I did, such deep and bitter agony. I gnashed my teeth and ground them together, uttering a groan that came from my inmost soul.

feels.name: Anguish
feels.quote: I passed a night of unmingled wretchedness.

feels.name: Despair
feels.quote: Alas! How shall I ever again believe in human goodness?

feels.name: Grief
feels.quote: Oh, Justine! Forgive me for having for one moment distrusted you.

feels.name: Remorse
feels.quote: I did confess, but I confessed a lie. I confessed, that I might obtain absolution; but now that falsehood lies heavier at my heart than all my other sins.

feels.name: Resignation
feels.quote: God raises my weakness and gives me courage to endure the worst. I leave a sad and bitter world; and if you remember me and think of me as of one unjustly condemned, I am resigned to the fate awaiting me.

Places.name: Courtroom
Places.description: Where the trial of Justine Moritz took place.

Places.name: Prison_room
Places.description: Where Justine Moritz was held in prison.

Places.name: Personal_space
Places.description: Where Victor Frankenstein experienced personal anguish.
